Message:
The guilt I felt seeing her tears
made my chest sting.
As if confessing a deep sin,
I blurted out my overflowing
feelings of remorse.

“My grandmother died,
but I haven’t
been able to cry at all...
I’m a horrible grandchild,
aren’t I...”

“But, you look like
you’re on the verge
of tears as we speak.”

With those words as the trigger,
I was suddenly hit
by a flood of memories.

Our life together in the forest.
Her deeply wrinkled,
but warm hands.

Her face that had once
looked so close to tears...

As I remembered all of this,
I felt something hot rush
to the corners of my eyes.

I...don’t want to
believe she’s gone...!
I want more time with her...!

I hate the thought of
never seeing her again...!
Of course...
it makes me sad...!
